dialogue: Madame, thank you, for covering for me. And I'm-- humbled, by your munificent offer, but my father would never allow it!
Just leave your father to me. I shall speak to him post haste!
How long have you had this... talent?
Talent? No. Something just-- comes over me, sometimes. Something I can't control... And when it does... bad things happen.
If you can learn to use your powers... in the right way...
Oh, Miss Elphaba...
The Wizard!?
Try again.
Eyes shut. Toes clenched. Are your toes clenched?
I-- think so.
And picture it. Are you picturing?
Now... levitate the coin.
I hear there was an unfortunate disturbance in Doctor Dillamond's class today. That must have been distressful for you.
Someone wrote those horrendible words, on purpose, for him to see-- I just wish--
What. You wish-- what?
That there was something I could do! Because no one should be--
No one should be what?
Scorned, or laughed at, or looked down upon, or told to stop jabbering AND KEEP QUIET!
Remarkable. Absolutely remarkable.
Once you learn to harness your emotions... the sky's the limit.
Doctor Dillamond! Did you find out who--
Miss Elphaba-- Look!
I finally heard back from the Wizard. And look--!
"His Royal Ozness, the Wonderful Wizard of Oz, summons you most ceremony-ishly to his personal Palace in the Emerald City."
"This invitation is non- transferable." Oh Madame!
This is your chance. To make good. Of course, you'll have to prove yourself first.
Prove myself?
Prove yourself worthy. Dearie, this is the Wizard of Oz! If he's going to grant your heart's desire--
But-- prove myself how?! It's too soon, I'm not ready--!
Don't be so pessi-mystical. You'll find a way. I have faith in you.
Mustn't let you get wet! Not when you're on the cusp of greatness!
A lost language... our lost language of spells.
Don't be discouraged if you can't decipherate it, Dearie, I myself can only read a word or two, and that took years and years of--
Ah-- tay...? Tah... tay?
Praise Oz!
What did I tell you?
Chistery! Are you all right?
It's just the transition, Dearie...
He's in pain--! Quick, how do I reverse it?
Reverse it? A spell from The Grimmerie can never be reversed, did we not cover that--?
Oh no... no...!
I knew it! I knew she had the power, I told you!
Yes, they'll make perfect spies!
Spies??!
We're doing this to keep people safe. All of Oz will benefit.
You've known all along... from the moment you met me.
You w ill benefit, too, Dearie. You must trust me--
Miss Elphaba, you are talking to the Wizard of Oz!
You can't read this book at all, can you?
That's why you need spies. And cages... and an enemy. You have no real power.
